1.text: Harvest the romaine heads about 65–70 days after planting the seeds.

2.text: Cut the entire head off above the base if you want a second harvest.

3.text: Give the lettuce time to re-sprout leaves after the first harvest.

4.text: Pull the romaine head out of the ground to ensure a single harvest.

5.text: Break any clumps of dirt off of the roots.

6.text: Break apart the lettuce head and rinse the individual leaves.

7.text: Harvest the lettuce in the morning for fresh, crisp leaves.

8.text: Pick the 6–8 outer leaves first to prolong the harvest.

9.text: Snap off romaine leaves with a sharp twist.

10.text: Harvest the inner leaves once they’ve reached about 4 inches (10 cm).

11.text: Rinse the harvested leaves and store them in the fridge for up to 10 days.
